intro: Carex paxii, commonly known as the saxifrage sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky or mountainous regions. The plant is characterized by its grass-like leaves and spike-like flower clusters, which are typical of the sedge family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Carex paxii is often used in rock gardens and as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
